column4: Maybe it has yet to be partitoned.  What does fdisk say about it?  sudo fdisk -l /dev/sdb
the oupput of fdisk -l dev/sdb is also nothing
If it does not have any partitions, create one:  sudo fdisk /dev/sdb and then p  to see what is really there and then  n  for new partition.  (m for help).
sudo fdisk -l /dev/sdb  | pastebinit    #Send us the URL and we'll have a look.

Is it even being recognized by the system as it is plugged in?  (To find out do this:  open a terminal, type tail: -f /var/log/messages Plug it in and see what comes across the screen in that terminal.
sudo fdisk -l /dev/sdb  | pastebinit    #Send us the URL and we'll have a look.
So what command did you use to try and format the partition /dev/sdb1 ?
Well, I don't know... You might just use mkdosfs
